required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Safety and Efficacy of Multiple-dose of WJ01024 in Subject With Advanced Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Dose Escalation and Dose Expansion Study of WJ01024 to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics and Preliminary Efficacy for Patients With Advanced Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: A clinical study of WJ01024 in subjects with advanced cancer in China, to evaluate the safety, tolerability, PK and efficacy of WJ01024. This study includes a dose escalation part and a dose expansion part. Patients receive WJ01024 on Day 1 and Day 3 of each week, 4 weeks as a cycle, until disease progression, or intolerable toxicity , withdrawal of consent, or end of the study, whichever occurs first.

primary_outcome.measure: The incidence of adverse events (AE) and serious adverse events (SAE) were assessed
primary_outcome.description: Incidence and severity of adverse events (AE) and serious adverse events (SAE) as assessed according to NCI-CTCAE 5.0, as well as abnormalities in vital signs, electrocardiogram, and laboratory tests

secondary_outcome.description: DLT, MTD, RP2D, Number of participants and severity with treatment-related Adverse events as assessed by CTCAE V5.0
Area under the concentration versus time curve from time 0 to the last measurable concentration
